result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelley Jo Spivey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Without Huber or work release privileges.

miscConds.notes:
Complete AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Comply with any no contacts, assessments and conditions per agent.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment within 60 days of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and shall follow through with any treatment that may be recommended within 30 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant shall comply with any drug testing required by diversion program for as long as diversion program feels testing is necessary.

Defendant shall abide by all the rules of Probation & Parole.  The agreement may be revoked if the defendant violates any rules of Probation & Parole regardless of what action Probation & Parole may take.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

timeConds.notes: Defendant shall complete 120 hours of community service within 30 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and provide the Monroe County Justice Department, Justice Program Coordinator or designee, with verification of said hours.

supervisions.notes: PP $50.00 PER MONTH DUE ON THE 15TH DAY OF EACH MONTH, FIRST PAYMENT DUE SEPTEMBER 15, 2017 AND THE NEXT PAYMENT DUE JANUARY 15, 2018

WITHOUT HUBER
Concurrent with 16CF561 & 17CF70 and consecutive to any other sentence serving
DEFENDANT ELIGIBLE FOR EXPUNGEMENT IF SHE GOES 3 YEARS WITHOUT ANY CRIMINAL CHARGES, CONVICTIONS OR REFERRALS; DEFENDANT TO WRITE TO THE COURT.
